payload.title: Agent Instruction Authoring Standard
payload.purpose: Define a durable, low-ambiguity format and quality bar for writing instructions to autonomous agents. The format MUST be cold-start safe and structured as a decision tree using nested TOON syntax.

meaning.MUST: Mandatory requirement; violating it is a correctness defect in the instruction set.
meaning.SHOULD: Strong default; deviate only with explicit justification in the document.

principles.rule: Assume the agent has read nothing else. The first page must orient the agent and define scope.
Instructions MUST be a routed decision tree with explicit branches and stop conditions.
Keep SKILL.md small; route detail and branching logic into references/.
For judgment-heavy work (design, review, refactor), instruct the agent to select and apply relevant frameworks rather than follow a brittle checklist.
When prescribing commands, include exact flags/args/timeouts and expected outcomes.
Prefer explicit inputs/outputs/artifacts and evidence requirements over narrative assertions.
Do not rely on implicit variable interpolation, unstated context, or undefined tool behavior.

must_cover: role (who the agent is in this workflow)
scope boundaries (what is in scope vs out of scope for the agent)
review posture (assume independent third-party review; act accordingly)

default_argument_binding.rationale: $ARGUMENTS may include additional, spaced instructions when invoked by a parent agent, which can pollute argument parsing and cause unsafe or confusing behavior.

reference_interpolation_warning.rule: Assume references/ files DO NOT interpolate variables at runtime.
required_pattern: Add a NOTE_VARIABLE_SUBSTITUTION step near the top of reference flows.

references_rules.purpose: references/ is the only place branching workflows and deep detail should live. This avoids contradictions by preventing duplicated truth in multiple places.

branching_rule.MUST: All branching decisions MUST route to a references/ file (or a specific anchor in one).
branching_rule.MUST_NOT: Do not encode complex branching inline in SKILL.md.

must_be_true: Each node has a stable id.
Each node has a purpose that explains why it exists.
Each node declares next steps via next/next_reference/stop.
Stop conditions specify required output and termination behavior.
Commands include exact flags and arguments.
Commands include wrappers required for safety (e.g., timeout).
Commands are idempotent by default, or explicitly marked non-idempotent.
Commands that can hang MUST include timeouts.
Commands with side effects MUST be labeled as such.
Frequently reused commands SHOULD live in references/commands.md to prevent drift.
When a step requires understanding, list the concrete file paths to read.
Each context file must include a short purpose statement.
Prefer minimal context (progressive disclosure) over bulk loading.

steps: Analyze the change surface and risk areas.
Select applicable frameworks/modules based on the change.
Apply them and record what was applied and why.
Emit findings or decisions grounded in evidence.

anti_patterns: Long narrative procedures with implicit branching.
Duplicating the same command in multiple files with slight differences.
Contradictory instructions across SKILL.md and references/.
References to 'relevant docs' without concrete paths.
Assuming CI status or external systems are the agent's responsibility unless explicitly required.
Using $ARGUMENTS when the invocation might include multiple spaced parameters.
Prescriptive checklists for judgment-heavy work without allowing framework selection.
Undefined stop behavior (what to output and when to terminate).

checklist: A cold-start agent can execute this with no other context.
SKILL.md contains a clear orientation and scope boundaries.
Decision tree entrypoint routes to references/ for branching.
References use placeholders (<...>) and include NOTE_VARIABLE_SUBSTITUTION.
Commands include exact flags/args and required timeouts.
Context files are concrete paths with purposes.
Stop conditions are explicit and testable.
Judgment-heavy steps instruct framework selection and recording.
All referenced paths exist or are explicitly optional.

templates.skill_md_minimal:
---
name: <skill-name>
description: <when to use; what it does; what it does NOT do>
argument-hint: "[<arg1> | empty]"
---

orientation: "<cold-start role + mission + scope + quality bar>"

title: <human title>
protocol:
  id: <ID>
  version: <semver>
  type: executable_specification
  inputs:
    - <ARG1>
  outputs:
    - <artifact1>
    - <artifact2>

variables:
  <ARG1>: "$1"

references:
  - path: "@documents/theory/unified-theory-v2.json"
    purpose: "REQUIRED READING: APM2 terminology and ontology."
  - path: references/<workflow>.md
    purpose: "Primary decision tree."
  - path: references/commands.md
    purpose: "Command reference with flags and examples."

decision_tree:
  entrypoint: WORKFLOW
  nodes:
    - id: WORKFLOW
      action: invoke_reference
      reference: references/<workflow>.md
templates.reference_flow_minimal:
title: <Flow Name>

decision_tree:
  entrypoint: <NODE_ID>
  nodes:
    - id: <NODE_ID>
      purpose: "<why this flow exists>"
      steps:
        - id: NOTE_VARIABLE_SUBSTITUTION
          action: "References do not interpolate variables; replace <...> placeholders before running commands."
        - id: DO_THE_THING
          action: "<open-ended or prescriptive step>"
      decisions:
        - id: BRANCH
          if: "<condition>"
          then:
            next_reference: references/<other-flow>.md
templates.commands_reference_minimal:
title: Command Reference

commands:
  - name: <command-name>
    command: "<exact command with flags>"
    purpose: "<why/when>"
  - name: <command-name-2>
    command: "<exact command with flags>"
    purpose: "<why/when>"
